name: Teriyaki Tofu Veggie Brown Rice Bowls
description: Crispy tofu and mixed vegetables in a mild teriyaki glaze over brown basmati rice for a balanced, protein-forward family dinner. Simple stir-fry technique with a quick pan sauce.
prep_steps: Rinse 1.5 cups brown basmati rice under cold water until it runs clear.
Cut 600 g tofu into 2 cm cubes and pat dry with paper towels.
In a small bowl, whisk 1/3 cup teriyaki sauce, 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp rice vinegar, 2 tsp cornflour, and 1/3 cup water; set aside.
Cut 1 large head broccoli into small florets; peel and slice the stalk thinly.
Slice 4 spring onion (whites and greens separated).
cook_steps: Add rinsed brown basmati rice and 3 cups water to a pot with a pinch of salt; bring to a boil, reduce to low, cover, and simmer 25–30 minutes until tender. Rest covered 5 minutes, then fluff.
Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add tofu cubes; season with a pinch of salt and black pepper. Cook 6–8 minutes, turning to brown on multiple sides.
Push tofu to one side; add 1 tsp sesame oil and the broccoli. Stir-fry 3 minutes.
Add 300–400 g stir-fry vegetables and spring onion whites; stir-fry 3–4 minutes until crisp-tender.
Add minced garlic; stir 30 seconds until fragrant.
Whisk the teriyaki mixture, then pour into the pan. Toss gently and cook 1–2 minutes until the sauce thickens and coats tofu and vegetables. Adjust with a splash of water if too thick.
Taste and season with a little black pepper and a few drops of soy sauce if needed. Finish with 1 tsp sesame oil off heat.
Serve bowls of rice topped with teriyaki tofu and vegetables. Garnish with spring onion greens and 1 tbsp sesame seeds.

plus a few drops to taste
